item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee
Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. (text of measure as introduced: CR S1085)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S1085-1086)

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) the Secretary of Education should provide the maximum flexibility possible in assisting predominantly rural States and school districts in meeting the unique challenges presented to them by the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001 (NCLBA); (2) the President's FY 2004 budget should request the full levels of funding authorized under NCLBA for all programs, including the Rural Education Achievement Program; and (3) if the President does not request and Congress does not provide full funding for NCLBA in FY 2004, Congress should suspend the enforcement of the implementation of NCLBA requirements until full funding is provided.

bill.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the implementation of the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001.

item.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the implementation of the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001.
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the implementation of the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
